definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
a hair's breadth apart/a fine line/a fine distinction

sentences.english: Frontline turnover is one of the biggest headaches for call center managers.
sentences.chinese: 對治理者來說，一線坐席辭職是最爲頭痛的標題。

sentences.english: In the same way, the Lord took the time and effort to stitch you together.
sentences.chinese: 同樣的，上帝也是一針一線把你縫紉起來。

sentences.english: The goal also is to reduce shop floor decision-making.
sentences.chinese: 它的目標還包括減少在生產一線的決策。

sentences.english: There's a very thin dividing line between joviality and hysteria.
sentences.chinese: 激動和歇斯底里之間就一線之隔。

sentences.english: The actor for another leading character is reportedly to be selected from well-known Hong Kong stars.
sentences.chinese: 另一個男主角據報道會在香港一線明星當中選擇。

sentences.english: Develop educational and training plans for team leaders and production operators.
sentences.chinese: 爲班組長及生產一線員工制定教育培訓計劃。

sentences.english: Another 480 mental employees in the same plant were selected (Group-C).
sentences.chinese: 以480名非一線工人爲對照組。

sentences.english: Lester had been famous among the line workers for a magic trick.
sentences.chinese: 萊斯特在一線員工中以一種魔術把戲而聞名。

sentences.english: Two pairs of attractive men and women were led by first-line emotional destiny.
sentences.chinese: 兩對俊男美女的情感命運被牽一線。

sentences.english: Frontline turnover is one of the biggest headaches for call center managers. There are many reasons why agents quit.
sentences.chinese: 對治理者來說，一線坐席辭職是最爲頭痛的標題。

sentences.english: He made his first-team breakthrough at River Plate earlier this season.
sentences.chinese: 本賽季伊始，他被提升至河牀的一線隊。

sentences.english: A faint hope still flickered in his breast .
sentences.chinese: 她心中仍然閃現着一線希望。

sentences.english: A reflection of that heaven rested on the Bishop.
sentences.chinese: 來自天空的一線彩光正射在主教的身上。

sentences.english: Your A-squad will still be able to play on sundays and wednesdays right?
sentences.chinese: 一線隊週中週末比賽不受影響吧？

sentences.english: Arsène Wenger still believes that Henri Lansbury has the ability to break through at Arsenal.
sentences.chinese: 溫格依然相信蘭斯伯裏有潛力成爲阿森納的一線球員。

sentences.english: Professor Zeng Yi has remained consistently at the forefront of the battle against Aids in China.
sentences.chinese: 曾毅教授一直戰鬥在艾滋病戰鬥的第一線。

definition: thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
to fight in one place after another
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
to flow/to circulate/to go from place to place/to be mobile/(of assets) liquid
